com.pb.sawdust.util.parsing

Class FixedWidthStringParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.parsing.ArrayParser<char[],java.lang.String>
      • com.pb.sawdust.util.parsing.FixedWidthStringParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parser<char[],java.lang.String>

    public class FixedWidthStringParser
extends ArrayParser<char[],java.lang.String>
    The FixedWidthStringParser class parses character arrays into Strings formed from character sub-arrays.
    See Also:
    ArrayParser

    • Constructor Detail

      • FixedWidthStringParser

        public FixedWidthStringParser(int[] widths)
        Constructor specifying the widths of the subarrays used when parsing inputs. All widths must be greater than 0, except the final width, which may also be ArrayParser.OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH, indicating an "open" (variable width) final subarray. An open subarray allows the final subarray to be empty if the input array's length is equal to the sum of positive widths.
        Parameters:
        widths - The widths of the subarrays resulting from the parsing of an input array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if element in widths is less than one (final element is allowed to be equal to ArrayParser.OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH).

      • FixedWidthStringParser

        public FixedWidthStringParser(int[] positions,
                      int arrayLength)
        Constructor specifying breakpoint positions and the input array length. Widths (as used in ArrayParser(int[]) constructor) are determined implicitly by the positions. If positions[0] == 0, then the size of the output array will be positions.length, otherwise the size of the output array will be positions.length + 1 (the parsing algorithm assumes a start at input element 0). A positive arrayLength parameter determines the width of the final element as arrayLength - positions[positions.length-1]. Alternatively, the arrayLength parameter may be set to ArrayParser.OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH, which sets the final subarray to be open (equivalent to setting the final width to OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH).
        Parameters:
        positions - The breakpoint positions for the subarrays resulting from the parsing of an input array.
        arrayLength - The minimum length of an input array, or OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH for an open final subarray.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if arrayLength != OPEN_FINAL_SUBARRAY_WIDTH and arrayLength is less than the sum of the elements in positions.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public java.lang.String[] parse(java.lang.String input)
        Parse a string using this parser. This call is equivalenr to calling parse(input.toCharArray[]).
        Parameters:
        input - The string to parse.
        Returns:
        an array of strings corresponding to the parsed input.
